revised_title: Dehydration and Cooling Effects on Hydrated Platin-Cyanides
tldr: The authors investigated the dehydration of hydrated platin-cyanides when cooled. They discovered that the color change in the crystals was due to the separation of a colored cryohydrate film on the surface of each crystal, rather than a change in the crystal structure. The study helps to clarify the understanding of the behavior of hydrated salts when cooled.
